meanings.definition: A growth or development that arises from something else
meanings.sent1: The new flower on the plant was an outgrowth of the healthy soil.
meanings.sent2: The increased interest in the topic was a direct outgrowth of the successful presentation.
meanings.sent3: The outgrowth of new ideas in the brainstorming session was both exciting and productive.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for painting was an outgrowth of her love for colors and creativity.
meanings.sent5: The outgrowth of the tree branches created a beautiful canopy in the garden.

meanings.sent1: The argument between the siblings was an outgrowth of their differing opinions.
meanings.sent2: The outgrowth of the rainy weather was lush greenery all around.
meanings.sent3: The outgrowth of the baking experiment was a delicious cake that surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The outgrowth of her hard work was a promotion at her job.
meanings.sent5: The outgrowth of the team's collaboration was a successful project completion.

meanings.definition: A protrusion or projection from a surface
meanings.sent1: The outgrowth on the tree trunk looked like a small branch trying to grow.
meanings.sent2: The outgrowth on the rock face provided a foothold for the climber.
meanings.sent3: The outgrowth on the wall seemed to be waving at the passersby in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: The outgrowth on the mushroom cap gave it a unique and textured appearance.
meanings.sent5: The outgrowth on the crystal surface refracted light in a mesmerizing pattern.
